column4: does anyone know how can i manually unlock ubuntu10.10 from cli?
unlock as in locked out of your login account?
screen to unlock?  like the gdm screen?  can't you just enter the password?
xscreensaver
screensaver+lock is running, i want to be able to have a command to both unlock and stop the screensaver, this should be something like xscreensaver-command -d but it doesnt do the trick
oh I think I understand, so if you ssh in you can unlock the screen and bring up vnc or something like that,  I'm not sure but there must be a way
this might be totaly the wrong path to take but maybe x11 keystroke from cli with http://www.semicomplete.com/projects/xdotool/xdotool
even if i can change the keystrokes, i still need it to enter my password.. so im not sure about this
can't you just disable the screensaver ?
maybe look at http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/lucid/man1/gnome-control-center.1.html
even if i disable the screensaver, i still need to enter a password
im trying to have lock/unlock of my ubuntu from my phone's bluetooth
well without the screensaver it would always be online to access with vnc
ok I got cha,  let me look
ok I found it http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/maverick/man1/xdg-screensaver.1.html
now all you need is software from your phone to triger run that line
xdg stops the screen but not the lock
i guess i could write a script to kill the screensaver..
reset            Turns the screensaver off immediately. If the screen was locked the            user may be asked to authenticate first.
I would try lock and reset from the command line and see what happens
, doesnt work
i found a way to do it but it involvs killing my xscreensaver :)
that sounds like it would work then , just kill it and restart again at some point or at some time after
